ygData.subject: RE: Speed of a bard
ygData.msgSnippet: The other day when i was hunting in Steamfont a Guide showed up and was just standing there next to us.  He was kind of fun to talk to, explained to us why we
ygData.messageBody:
The other day when i was hunting in Steamfont a Guide showed up and was just
standing there next to us. He was kind of fun to talk to, explained to us
why we dont see GM Solist anymore on Sol Ro, Seems he got killed by Nagafen.
And from there a second guide guild was formed, an evil one...

Anyways, i asked him if he would race me, i equipped my mm drum and blasted
way ahead of him, but turned out he didnt have run on (duh)

Next 2 rounds of races we did we were neck and neck for each race. Im sure
my level 40 friend would of left him in the dust

If he's still around when i hit level 50, we've got another race to do, me
and this little gnome

i think i gave him a new respect for bards and their speed.

Minkin Nehoc
Sol Ro
Lev 35 bard

> -----Original Message-----
> From: hho@... [SMTP:hho@...]
> Sent: October 8, 1999 7:19 AM
> To: eqbards@onelist.com
> Subject: [eqbards] Speed of a bard
>
> From: hho@...
>
> Hiya,
> Dont know if this is of any interest, but its bardic related.
> Inspirered by the thread about running back to your corpse I decided to
> time my
> run From Qeynos gates to West freeport through Highpass hold (Invisio on
> when I
> passed through there).
>
> My stats: Woodelf bard, Level 22, Hand drum.
> The time: 31min.
>
> While I was at it I also timed how long time it took me to zone (From
> "loading
> please wait" until I could move on the other side): 40-60 secs(Dont have
> the
> exact times here, but never above 60secs, that much I remember)
>
> My pc's stats:
> P166MMX running 188/75MHz
> Flash3D voodoo I card.
> Win98
> 96MB Ram, BTW started with 64 in beta, My advice? 96MB is a minimum!
> Connection: ISDN 64Kbit/s
>
> Musiker Silverdrum, Bertox.
>
> > Please send submissions for the eqbards newsletter to toren@...
> with the subject lol.
